channel.title: Changing cache
channel.description:
I have my New cache in Dropbox How do I get the link that I need to put in Cachedownloader and client?
Just to be clear so I mean the public link, I dont know how you get it anymore in this dropbox version

item.title: Changing cache
item.dc:creator: @pkonlynoob pkonlynoob
item.description:
@pkonlynoob wrote:

Okay. It works to. When i start client it starts downloading cache to 100% then Loading cache library is starting and at 98% it comes up" Error loading… please report!"
this is how the client cmd looks like when i start it
http://prntscr.com/54fq85
then when the error comes it looks like this
http://prntscr.com/54frff

Read full topic

item.title: Changing cache
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

pkonlynoob:

I did try to http://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/ and added the rest. Then I did put that link in files “client” and cachedownloader" when I’m starting client it comes error loading… is the link wrong? or anything else?

The link you gave me should be fine. Assuming you have the cache zipped correctly, there should be no issues.

Read full topic

item.title: Changing cache
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“pkonlynoob, post:1, topic:547699”]I have my New cache in Dropbox
How do I get the link that I need to put in Cachedownloader and client?

Just to be clear so I mean the public link, I dont know how you get it anymore in this dropbox version[/quote]
It’s odd to explain… Er can you get the “share link” link for me?
I can show you how to make it your instant download link for your cache.
Basically, dropbox made the “public” folder a paid feature. Why? Unknown. But all the users that already had it, kept it.
So you need to change the beginning of the link to the right domain and it’ll work.
I believe it’s just http://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/ the other half of your link here

Read full topic
